intro: Ectrosia squarrulosa f. minor, commonly known as the small-leaved ectrosia, is a rare horticultural form of the species. It is characterized by its smaller, more compact leaves compared to the typical form. The plant belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is native to tropical regions of South America. It thrives in warm, humid environments with bright, indirect light. Its unique foliage makes it a sought-after specimen for collectors and enthusiasts.
